title: It's A Beautiful Tree But It Causes A Stink
teaser: The disease-resistant Callery pear once was American cities' street tree of choice. One community in Pennsylvania has banned it. This story originally aired on All Things Considered on April 24, 2015.
contentencoded:
The disease-resistant Callery pear became American cities' street tree of choice starting in the 1950s. One community in Pennsylvania, fed up with the stench, has banned it.

This story originally aired on All Things Considered on April 24, 2015.

Copyright 2015 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
